node.title: Bail for Darrell Brooks Set at $5 Million as Sixth Victim Dies
node.alt: Bail for Darrell Brooks, the man suspected of driving into a crowd at a Christmas parade on November 21 in Waukesha, was set at $5 million on Tuesday. Above, a makeshift memorial is pictured along the route of the parade on W Main Street in Waukesha, Wisconsin on November 22, 2021, the day after a vehicle drove through a Christmas parade.
node.description: Waukesha County Court Commissioner Kevin Costello said the bail amount was "extraordinarily high" but "warranted."
node.content:
["Darrell Brooks Jr., the man suspected of driving into a crowd at a Christmas parade in Waukesha, Wisconsin on November 21, was charged Tuesday with five felony counts of first-degree intentional homicide.", "After detailing the charges and listening to an overview of criminal charges Brooks has faced in the past during his Tuesday afternoon court appearance, Waukesha County Court Commissioner Kevin Costello set Brooks' cash bail at $5 million.", "Costello said that bail amount was \"extraordinarily high\" but \"warranted.\"", "", "
Bail for Darrell Brooks, the man suspected of driving into a crowd at a Christmas parade on November 21 in Waukesha, was set at $5 million on Tuesday. Above, a makeshift memorial is pictured along the route of the parade on W Main Street in Waukesha, Wisconsin on November 22, 2021, the day after a vehicle drove through a Christmas parade.
", "\"I've not seen anything like this in my very long career,\" Costello said. He added it appeared to him to be \"a very strong case for the state.\"", "\"It's an extraordinarily serious case with an extraordinary history of this gentleman of fleeing, of hurting people, of not following court orders, not following criminal laws, not following, just, your societal norms,\" Costello said. \"So I know that that's extraordinarily high bail. It's warranted here.\"", "Dozens of people were injured after a vehicle drove into a crowd at the Sunday parade, and authorities confirmed five people had died in the hours after the incident occurred.", "During Brooks' court appearance, prosecutors said a sixth person had died. They said an additional count of first-degree intentional homicide was likely to be filed in the wake of the most recent death.", "This is a developing story and will be updated as more information becomes available."]
